meanings.sent1: Tommy is such a wus when it comes to spiders.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a wus, stand up for yourself!
meanings.sent3: The little wus was scared of his own shadow.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a wus surrounded by confident people.
meanings.sent5: Being a wus can hold you back from trying new things.

meanings.definition: To act in a cowardly or timid manner.
meanings.sent1: Don't wus out now; you can do it!
meanings.sent2: He tends to wus when faced with challenges.
meanings.sent3: She wussed out of the dare at the last minute.
meanings.sent4: I don't want to wus my way through life, I want to be brave.
meanings.sent5: If you wus every time, you'll never know your true potential.
